title: Cinderella
creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Citadel Entertainment, Storyline Entertainment, BrownHouse Productions, Ellen Mirojnick, Randy Ser and Robert Iscove
brief_description: This is the third television version of Rodgers & Hammerstein’s Cinderella; a musical written for television, with music by Richard Rodgers and a book and lyrics by Oscar Hammerstein II.

constellations_other.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_other.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney Pictures, Citadel Entertainment, Storyline Entertainment, BrownHouse Productions, Ellen Mirojnick, Randy Ser and Robert Iscove
description: Cinderella chafes under the cruelty of her wicked stepmother and her evil stepsisters, until her Fairy Godmother steps in to change her life for one unforgettable night. At the ball, she falls for handsome Prince Christopher, whose parents, King Maximillian and Queen Constantina, are anxious for him to find a suitable paramour.
